title: Why does Meghan Markle's father say she knowingly 'caused or allowed her 5 friends to speak anonymously' to US People magazine? - Quora

response.answer_text: Perhaps she did know her friends would speak anonymously to People Magazine. It does not give him a pass to sell the letter she wrote him to the Daily Mail on Sunday. He whines and moans that “they made him look bad”. Well, I’d say that a father who goes against a child’s wishes to not speak to the press not once but many times makes himself look bad. I know he was probably embarrassed by what was said in the interview-but you know what? He deserved it. And it’s not just Meghan who he’s let down in his family. He’s never bothered to meet two of his daughter Samantha’s children and the other three grandchildren said he never bothers with them. The poor homeless brother was not welcome in his father’s house (even Samantha said no one is to blame for his problems except himself), and it’s a safe bet Tom Markle didn’t send a dime from any of his interviews at Meghan’s expense to help his son Tom Junior get off the streets. He’s a bitter old man who is jealous of his youngest child’s success, instead of beaming with pride and celebrating her marriage. Instead, he’s a big part of the reason that Harry and Meghan have had to make the wrenching decision to step away from their senior-royal roles. I saw a book title the other day that made me think of him; it was called, “I Hate You, But Don’t Leave Me.” He wants the money that his association with Meghan brings him, but at the same time, perhaps he still genuinely wants a relationship with her. You can’t have it both ways, sir. You have to pick one, and hope it’s not too late to have the latter.

She “knowingly allowed” her friends to speak (anonymously or otherwise)? FFS, how is she supposed to stop them? Why is Meghan personally responsible for what her friends choose to do or not do? Old man Markle wants to just go away and listen to himself. This has got to be one of the most ridiculous things I’ve ever heard.
